A mutual fund is set up in the form of a trust which has (i) a sponsor, (ii) trustee, (iii) Asset management company (AMC) and (iv) Custodian. The trust is established by the sponsor who is like promoter of a company. The trustees of the mutual fund hold its property for the benefit of unit-holders. The trustees are vested with the general power of superintendence and direction over AMC. They monitor the performance and compliance of The SEBI regulations by the mutual fund. The AMC manages the funds by making investment in types of securities. The custodian holds the securities of the various schemes of the mutual fund in its safe custody. As an investment intermediary, mutual funds offer a variety of services/advantages to the relatively small investors who, on their own, cannot successfully construct and manage an investment portfolio mainly due to the small size of their funds, lack of expertise/experience and so on. This inter-alia, include convenience in terms of lower denomination of investment and liquidity, lower risk through diversification, export management and reduced transactioncost due to economies of scale.AMC manages funds by investing in(UGC NET Commerce Jun 2020)
  • A.Stock market securities only
  • B.Credit instruments only
  • C.Government bonds only
  • D.Various types of securities
Correct Answer: Various types of securities

It is a source based answer. The answer is chosen on the basis of these lines of the paragraph.

 

“The AMC manages the funds by making investment in types of securities.”

Question 6
A mutual fund is a special type of investment institution which acts as an investment conduit. It pools the savings of relatively small investors in a well diversifies portfolio of sound investment. Mutual funds issue securities (known as units) to the investors (known as unit holders) in accordance with the quantum of money invested by them. The profit (or losses) are shared by investors in proportion to their investments. A mutual fund is set up in the form of a trust which has (i) a sponsor, (ii) trustee, (iii) Asset management company (AMC) and (iv) Custodian. The trust is established by the sponsor who is like promoter of a company. The trustees of the mutual fund hold its property for the benefit of unit-holders. The trustees are vested with the general power of superintendence and direction over AMC. They monitor the performance and compliance of The SEBI regulations by the mutual fund. The AMC manages the funds by making investment in types of securities. The custodian holds the securities of the various schemes of the mutual fund in its safe custody. As an investment intermediary, mutual funds offer a variety of services/advantages to the relatively small investors who, on their own, cannot successfully construct and manage an investment portfolio mainly due to the small size of their funds, lack of expertise/experience and so on. This inter-alia, include convenience in terms of lower denomination of investment and liquidity, lower risk through diversification, export management and reduced transactioncost due to economies of scale.Which among the following is not a part of mutual funds trust?(UGC NET Commerce Jun 2020)
  • A.Sponsor
  • B.Custodian
  • C.Depository
  • D.Trustees
Correct Answer: Depository

It is a source based answer. The answer is chosen on the basis of these lines of the paragraph.

 

“A mutual fund is set up in the form of a trust which has (i) a sponsor (ii) trustee (iii) Asset management company (AMC) and (iv) custodian.”

Question 7
A mutual fund is a special type of investment institution which acts as an investment conduit. It pools the savings of relatively small investors in a well diversifies portfolio of sound investment. Mutual funds issue securities (known as units) to the investors (known as unit holders) in accordance with the quantum of money invested by them. The profit (or losses) are shared by investors in proportion to their investments. A mutual fund is set up in the form of a trust which has (i) a sponsor, (ii) trustee, (iii) Asset management company (AMC) and (iv) Custodian. The trust is established by the sponsor who is like promoter of a company. The trustees of the mutual fund hold its property for the benefit of unit-holders. The trustees are vested with the general power of superintendence and direction over AMC. They monitor the performance and compliance of The SEBI regulations by the mutual fund. The AMC manages the funds by making investment in types of securities. The custodian holds the securities of the various schemes of the mutual fund in its safe custody. As an investment intermediary, mutual funds offer a variety of services/advantages to the relatively small investors who, on their own, cannot successfully construct and manage an investment portfolio mainly due to the small size of their funds, lack of expertise/experience and so on. This inter-alia, include convenience in terms of lower denomination of investment and liquidity, lower risk through diversification, export management and reduced transactioncost due to economies of scale.Mutual fund is(UGC NET Commerce Jun 2020)
  • A.Investment intermediary
  • B.Venture capitalist
  • C.NBFC
  • D.Non-profit organization
Correct Answer: Investment intermediary

It is a source based answer. The answer is chosen on the basis of these lines of the paragraph.

 

“A mutual fund is a special type of investment institution which acts as an investment conduit.”

Question 8
Which one of the following is NOT the characteristic of mutual funds? (UGC NET Commerce Jun 2021)
  • A.Consistent Investment process
  • B.Strong fund management
  • C.Diversity in interest rates
  • D.Differences from the benchmark
Correct Answer: Diversity in interest rates

A mutual fund is a collective investment that pools together the money of a large number of

Investors to purchase a number of securities like stocks, bonds etc.

 

Characteristics of mutual funds are:

1. Opportunity to invest in diversified securities.

2. Can be low risky and high risky depends upon in which type of MF you invested.

3. Consistence investment process.

4. Strong fund management.

5. Differences from the benchmark.

 

There is no question of diversity in interest rates in mutual fund in Indian money market. Hence, option C is the correct answer.

Question 9
SEBI’s ‘Skin in the game’ rule is applicable to which of the following financial intermediaries? (UGC NET Commerce Jun 2022)
  • A.Merchant bankers
  • B.Financial Advisors
  • C.Mutual Funds
  • D.Brokerages
Correct Answer: Mutual Funds

SEBI’s skin-in-the-game rule aims to align the interest of the Key employees of the mutual fund house with the unit holders of its schemes.

 

As per the rule, Key Employees of the asset management companies will have to mandatorily invest a minimum of 20% of the salary/ perks/ bonus/ non-cash compensation (gross annual CTC) net of income tax and any statutory contributions i.e. PF and NPS, in the units of Mutual Fund schemes in which they have a role/ oversight.

Question 10
Which of the following are not models used for evaluating the performance of Mutual Funds? (UGC NET Commerce Aug 2016)I. Miller ModelII. Sharpe ModelIII. Lintner ModelIV. Jenson ModelV. Treynor ModelCodes:
  • A.I, II, III
  • B.I, IV, V
  • C.I, II
  • D.I, III
Correct Answer: I, III

Sharpe, Jensen and Treynor Models are used for evaluating performance of Mutual Funds. These are called risk adjusted measures that adjust the return for the underlying risk.

 

Sharpe’s measure

This expresses the risk premium in terms of per unit of total risk.

 

Sharpe’s Ratio, SP = Return of Portfolio-Return of risk free investmentStandard deviation of Portfolio

 

The higher the Sharpe’s ratio, the better it is.

 

Treynor’s measure

This measure uses systematic risk as indicated by beta factor.

 

Treynor’s Ratio, TP = Return of Portfolio-Return of risk free investmentBeta of Portfolio

 

The higher the Treynor’s ratio, the better it is.

 

Jensen’s measure (or Jensen’s alpha)

It is the actual return on the portfolio over and above the CAPM (Capital Asset Pricing Model) predicted return.

 

Jensen’s alpha, αj = Actual Return – Expected Return under CAPM

 

The higher the alpha, the better it is.

Quiz Attempts 11-20 of 849
